content: Follow your heart, listen to your inner voice, stop caring about what others think. — Roy T. Bennett
author: Zen Quotes

content: Surround yourself with people who take their work seriously, but not themselves, those who work hard and play hard. — Colin Powell
author: Zen Quotes

content: One of the first signs of the beginning of understanding is the wish to die.  — Franz Kafka
author: Zen Quotes

content: Our attitude toward life determines life's attitude towards us. — Earl Nightingale
author: Zen Quotes

content: Where words fail, music speaks. — Hans Christian Andersen
author: Zen Quotes

content: I do not seek. I find. — Pablo Picasso
author: Zen Quotes

content: We can either add to our character each day, or we can fritter away our energies in distractions. — Ming-Dao Deng
author: Zen Quotes

content: Greatness comes from living with purpose and passion. — Ralph Marston
author: Zen Quotes

content: Self-knowledge is the beginning of self-correction. — Norman Vincent Peale
author: Zen Quotes

content: Where ever you are, you are one with the clouds and one with the sun and the stars you see. You are one with everything. — Shunryu Suzuki
author: Zen Quotes

content: I believe that one of life's greatest risks is never daring to risk. — Oprah Winfrey
author: Zen Quotes

content: Fishing is much more than fish. — Herbert Hoover
author: Zen Quotes

content: You need a plan to build a house. To build a life, it is even more important to have a plan or goal. — Zig Ziglar
author: Zen Quotes

content: There is nothing more truly artistic than to love people. — Vincent van Gogh
author: Zen Quotes

content: Evil is whatever distracts.  — Franz Kafka
author: Zen Quotes

content: Never regret your past. Rather, embrace it as the teacher that it is. — Robin Sharma
author: Zen Quotes

content: There is no truth. There is only perception. — Gustave Flaubert
author: Zen Quotes

content: To live outside the law, you must be honest.  — Bob Dylan

content: Just as true humor is laughter at oneself, true humanity is knowledge of oneself. — Alan Watts
author: Zen Quotes

content: Being wrong opens us up to the possibility of change. — Mark Manson
author: Zen Quotes

content: This is the real secret of life - to be completely engaged with what you are doing in the here and now. And instead of calling it work, realize it is play. — Alan Watts
author: Zen Quotes

content: The ego wants to go fast. The soul needs to go slow. — Maxime Lagace
author: Zen Quotes

content: Sometimes it is harder to deprive oneself of a pain than of a pleasure. — F. Scott Fitzgerald
author: Zen Quotes

content: Motivation is what gets you started. Habit is what keeps you going. — Jim Rohn
author: Zen Quotes

content: Nothing external to you has any power over you. — Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: We create the world and ourselves; — Ming-Dao Deng
author: Zen Quotes

content: Debt is the slavery of the free. — Publilius Syrus
author: Zen Quotes

content: Failure means you've now learned another valuable lesson that pushes you one step closer to success. — Steve Harvey

content: Receive without complaint, Work with fate. — Ming-Dao Deng
author: Zen Quotes

content: What the caterpillar calls the end of the world, the master calls a butterfly. — Richard Bach
author: Zen Quotes

content: Common sense is not so common.  — Voltaire
author: Zen Quotes

content: Change is not a four letter word...but often your reaction to it is! — Jeffrey Gitomer

content: Always seek out the seed of triumph in every adversity. — Og Mandino

content: Knowing is not enough, we must apply. Willing is not enough, we must do.   — Bruce Lee
author: Zen Quotes

content: Never argue with stupid people, they will drag you down to their level and then beat you with experience. — Mark Twain
author: Zen Quotes

content: Never give way to laziness. — Bhagavad Gita
author: Zen Quotes

content: When obstacles arise, you change your direction to reach your goal; you do not change your decision to get there. — Zig Ziglar
author: Zen Quotes

content: The first thing you learn in life is you're a fool. The last thing you learn in life is you're the same fool.   — Ray Bradbury
author: Zen Quotes

content: Note that this journey is uniquely yours, no one elses. So the path has to be your own. — Jon Kabat-Zinn
author: Zen Quotes

content: You cannot always control what goes on outside. But you can always control what goes on inside.  — Wayne Dyer
author: Zen Quotes

content: To understand the heart and mind of a person, look not at what he has already achieved, but at what he aspires to. — Kahlil Gibran
author: Zen Quotes

content: Work as though you would live forever, and live as though you would die today. Go another mile. — Og Mandino
author: Zen Quotes

content: Forget mistakes. Forget failure. Forget everything except what you are going to do now and do it. Today is your lucky day! — Og Mandino
author: Zen Quotes

content: When you are able to employ your will always for constructive purposes, you become the controller of your destiny. — Paramahansa Yogananda
author: Zen Quotes

content: We tend to live up to our expectations. — Earl Nightingale
author: Zen Quotes

content: Be not glad at the misfortune of another, though he may be your enemy.  — George Washington
author: Zen Quotes

content: Stop being a prisoner of your past. Become the architect of your future. — Robin Sharma
author: Zen Quotes

content: All know that the drop merges into the ocean, but few know that the ocean merges into the drop. — Kabir
author: Zen Quotes

content: Either you choose to stay in the shallow end of the pool or you go out into the ocean. — Christopher Reeve
author: Zen Quotes

content: The mind that turns ever outward Will have no end to craving. Only the mind turned inward Will find a still-point of peace. — Ming-Dao Deng
author: Zen Quotes

content: Try not to become a man of success, but rather try to become a man of value. — Albert Einstein
author: Zen Quotes

content: Reversing your treatment of the man you have wronged is better than asking his forgiveness. — Elbert Hubbard

content: Beauty is not in the face; beauty is a light in the heart. — Kahlil Gibran

content: It is better to disappoint people with the truth than to appease them with a lie. — Simon Sinek
author: Zen Quotes

content: Give credit where credit is due: simply said, if you want loyalty and best effort, you must be thoughtful.   — Estee Lauder

content: Silence is a source of great strength. — Lao Tzu
author: Zen Quotes

content: Being a good example is the best form of service. — Sathya Sai Baba
author: Zen Quotes

content: The secret of life isn't what happens to you, but what you do with what happens to you. — Norman Vincent Peale
author: Zen Quotes

content: Better the cottage where one is merry than the palace where one weeps. — Chinese Proverb

content: The road to success is always under construction. — Steve Harvey

content: Expect the best of yourself, and then do what is necessary to make it a reality. — Ralph Marston
author: Zen Quotes

content: Success is liking yourself, liking what you do, and liking how you do it. — Maya Angelou

content: People who have goals succeed because they know where they're going. It's that simple. — Earl Nightingale

content: No one returns from a long journey the same person they were before. — Zen Proverb

content: It takes half your life before you discover life is a do-it-yourself project. — Napoleon Hill

content: He who knows how to wait need make no concessions. — Sigmund Freud

content: You'll see it when you believe it.  — Wayne Dyer

content: Your spirit is the true shield. — Morihei Ueshiba

content: We become what we believe. — Lolly Daskal

content: Never fear quarrels, but seek hazardous adventures. — Alexandre Dumas

content: Real growth comes through intense, difficult, and challenging situations. — Kamal Ravikant
author: Zen Quotes

content: Never stand begging for that which you have the power to earn. — Miguel de Cervantes

content: No man ever steps in the same river twice, for it's not the same river and he's not the same man. — Heraclitus

content: It's your outlook on life that counts. — Betty White

content: With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts. — Eleanor Roosevelt

content: There are no differences but differences of degree between different degrees of difference and no difference. — William James
author: Zen Quotes

content: It takes a minute to have a crush on someone, an hour to like someone, and a day to love someone... but it takes a lifetime to forget someone. — Kahlil Gibran
author: Zen Quotes

content: No great discovery was ever made without a bold guess.  — Isaac Newton
author: Zen Quotes

content: There are dark shadows on the earth, but its lights are stronger in the contrast. — Charles Dickens
author: Zen Quotes

content: Desire is suffering. — Naval Ravikant
author: Zen Quotes

content: Success seems to be connected to action. Successful people keep moving. They make mistakes, but they don't quit. — Conrad Hilton
author: Zen Quotes

content: All you need is the plan, the road map, and the courage to press on to your destination. — Earl Nightingale
author: Zen Quotes

content: It is often safer to be in chains than to be free.  — Franz Kafka
author: Zen Quotes

content: There is nothing more truly artistic than to love people. — Vincent van Gogh
author: Zen Quotes

content: Life is too short to waste your time on people who don't respect, appreciate, and value you. — Roy T. Bennett
author: Zen Quotes

content: Ability is a poor man's wealth. — John Wooden
author: Zen Quotes

content: To the world you may be one person; but to one person you may be the world. — Dr. Seuss

content: A pessimist sees the difficulty in every opportunity; an optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty. — Winston Churchill
author: Zen Quotes

content: The greatest deception men suffer is from their own opinions. — Leonardo da Vinci
author: Zen Quotes

content: The law of harvest is to reap more than you sow. Sow an act, and you reap a habit. Sow a habit and you reap a character. Sow a character and you reap a destiny. — James Allen

content: There is no significance in life without struggle. — Lolly Daskal
author: Zen Quotes

content: It's not how much money you make, it's how much money you keep. — Robert Kiyosaki
author: Zen Quotes

content: it's important to make sure that we're talking with each other in a way that heals, not in a way that wounds. — Barack Obama

content: Success is nothing more than a few simple disciplines practiced every day. — Jim Rohn
author: Zen Quotes

content: Life is not meant to be easy my child, but take courage: it can be delightful. — George Bernard Shaw
author: Zen Quotes

content: The truth... It is a beautiful and terrible thing, and should therefore be treated with great caution. — Albus Dumbledore
author: Zen Quotes

content: Whatever happened, happened for the good. Whatever is happening, is happening for the good. Whatever will happen, will also happen for the good. — Bhagavad Gita
author: Zen Quotes

content: Silence is sometimes the best answer. — Dalai Lama
author: Zen Quotes

content: The whole problem with the world is the fools and fanatics are always so sure of themselves, and wiser people are full of doubts. — George Bernard Shaw
author: Zen Quotes

content: Don't be afraid of missing opportunities. Behind every failure is an opportunity somebody wishes they had missed. — Lily Tomlin
